Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: kyrillz
Reviews.Content: Location is closed to down town, but the surrounding lack convenience for dinning. The staff are helpful but may depends on who is on duty. The rooms are small, but otherwise, clean and nicely kept.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal”
Reviews.Author: aniska
Reviews.Content: we've been there nights during Thanksgiving long weekend. No reservation. We arrived really late in the evening and after trying some other hotels (with much higher rates than what seen on internet, also considering the hour...no flexibility nowhere..) we decided to stay at this hotel. Price affordable, no parking but public parkings very close by. The receptionist was kind and helpful also with road directions for the following day. Internet and a small breakfast included in the rate. The room was very quiet and clean enough. The bedsheets were not ironed but clean, same for the towels in the bathroom. We had a great sleep and relaxed. This hotel is a good compromise if you want to be in the city center and don't want to pay a fortune on lodging.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin.”
Reviews.Author: ITCowboy
Reviews.Content: This is a bit of a belated review I stayed in the Econo Lodge about a year and a half ago on my first trip to Canada and I can say that it was perfect for what I wanted. There is no lift but then again it does not have that many floors so that is not a major drawback unless you have heavy cases but apart from that it was very clean and the room was good with a TV and Fridge, the bathroom was a reasonable size and also very clean. The location is easily within walking distance to the city centre which surprised me for the price so you can pop back for a break between the afternoon and evening events. I would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Simple Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: hward68342
Reviews.Content: The accommodations were good. There's no elevator. Granted, there really are no high floors. However, an elevator would have made getting my luggage up to my room a little easier. The continental breakfast was okay. But you can easily walk to a nearby diner, restaurant or fast food place like McDonald's if you want something more. My room had a queen sized bed. The room was small. But then again, it was just me in the room. The room which was on the 2nd floor overlooked the corner of Jarvis and Gerrard which at times was very busy. The bathroom was clean. Generally speaking i really have no complaints about this hotel. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for very basic accomdations.”
Reviews.Author: Melian5
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend were going to Toronto for two nights and booked last minute. Because it was the week of the Toronto International Film Festival this was one of the only hotels still available. We booked what was discribed as a Queen room. The room was extremely small but clean. The continential breakfast was comprised of bagels/toast, coffee, orange juice, milk, and cereal. My biggest problem with this hotel was that the nearest parking was almost a block away. The parking was $16 a day. There is nowhere to unload your car and you have to drag your luggage up the street. So pack light! The only other problem I had with this hotel was the pillows. They were horrible. Me and a friend shared the room and they only gave us two pillows and they were flat. So bring your own pillow if you want a comfortable night sleep. Really I probably would not stay here again, there are nicer hotels from about the same price if you book in advance. But if you do stay here there is nothing wrong with the place.

Reviews.Title: “Wish i had slept in my car”
Reviews.Author: Meier17
Reviews.Content: I got my first room there and it smelt like a wet dog, sheets were seemingly damp. I requested another room and it was slightly better, still had a bit of a bad smell, but i woke up with a couple bug bites, on my finger and back.i also payed $124 plus tax for the night, for only a little more you could have a nice room at the hilton, never again.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: 4givN
Reviews.Content: Not impressed upon arrival. The guy at the front desk was rude, and argumentative. I had requested on our reservation a room on the 3rd floor. When I asked him twice about this, he argued that it was a "request" not a "reservation". I figured that since he wasn't answering my question, we didn't get our "request"....wrong!! We did get our 3rd floor room, but it wasn't ready. It would've done much to calm our frazzled nerves if he'd just answered YES! We arrived 7 minutes from check in time...we waited 15 minutes before the room was ready. (On the contrary, when we called this hotel earlier, the woman we talked to was very pleasant and helpful) When we got to our room, the bathroom floor was still wet so we know that it had just been cleaned. However, we had no washcloths, no hand towels, and the air conditioner hadn't been turned on, so the room was stuffy and hot!! The room was clean, the bed was comfortable, but the pillows were flat as pancakes. I reccommend bringing your own! We had no trouble connecting to internet. We were on the back side of hotel, so noise wasn't an issue. Breakfast was not up to the standards of the American EconoLodges. Orange juice was little more than than orange water. 8:00 Saturday morning, and ALL the cereal was gone! They did say they were going out to get more cereal. My question is why didn't they realize on Friday night that there wasn't enough cereal for the weekend crowd!! Management needs to a better job and manage their supplies BEFORE they run out!! To their credit, they did have cereal about an hour later. We did manage to find parking for $10 for 24 hours right across from Ryerson University on Gerrard. So that was a bonus! Probably wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for basic accommodations”
Reviews.Author: TropicalMeg
Reviews.Content: I booked two nights in Toronto very last minute on hotwire. When I discovered I had booked the Econolodge and then read the terrible reviews I was very concerned. I thought I'd give it a go anyways, and I brought a couple other hotel numbers on standby. I was very pleasantly surprised when I entered the hotel to see a clean and modern reception area, and I was assisted by a very friendly and efficient employee. My room was clearly updated quite recently, with dark wood furniture, including a large armoire for storing my suitcase. The carpets, curtains, etc. were all in excellent repair, the bathroom was basic but very clean, and there was no odour at all in the hallway or my room. The free breakfast consists of juice, coffee, cereal and bagels- not a lot, but a quick way to start your day. The breakfast room was also clean and modern, with newspapers available, and a small TV screen showing the days' news. There is also free wi-fi throughout. That being said, I will make a couple of suggestions. As others have mentioned, there are three floors, and no elevators. If you're traveling with heavy luggage/multiple pieces/elderly/disabled/young children, CALL AHEAD and request a floor on the first room. Also, some of the rooms face Jarvis, which has steady traffic. A $2 pair of earplugs could change your experience from a lousy stay to a relaxing and issue-free one. Or request a room on the other side of the hotel. Overall, I would say this is a fine two star hotel. It is not glamorous, but 2-stars very rarely are. It is a basic, central and adequate place to crash, and you can't beat the price. I paid $60/night on hotwire.com... you can barely get a shared hostel room for that price in large urban centres.

Reviews.Title: “Staffs are so rude and charge you extra and hotel is not clean and rooms are noisy”
Reviews.Author: mouse-ottawa
Reviews.Content: The staff members are so rude, Before reservation, I called to get more information, The smoking room was not available. She told me that it is fine and I can select the non smoking room. When we checked in, actually same lady was in reception and she said it is fine. The first night, the room was too noisy and we could not sleep at all. The bathroom was not cleaned properly (there was lots of hairs). I was in Toronto for medical reason, I went to clinic and back around noon and ask to change the room. At this time I was forbidden to smoke for 48 hours. Therefore, I used nicotine patch during my treatment in Toronto. We change the room, sleep for 1 hour and back to clinic. In the morning I went to reception for the checkout, they told me they charged my credit card $100 more, since they think we smoke in the room. I told them that I did not smoke in the room, and can they come to the room to see it. They refused to come to room to check it with me. They told me they can charge me for $5000, I requested to give me the ticket. But they refuse it. They not giving any receipt for their extra charge. How they know without checking that we smoked in room. I think they are doing same thing for many people and cash the money for themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid - Dirty Bathrooms and poor attitude in response to complaints..”
Reviews.Author: uelc
Reviews.Content: Internet only works in a few rooms. Bathroom had multiple hairs on the toilet and tub. Obviously was not properly cleaned. Noisy rooms - kept up all night long. When you complain they argue with you instead of taking you seriously and working to an acceptable medium which in my case would have been a major discount on the room that night. I have been to this location other times with little problem but I will not be back after dealing with the front desk after this stay.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience-- STAY AWAY!”
Reviews.Author: collegetraveler651
Reviews.Content: The trip started out well enough. We went to the hotel to check in and I was greeted by a staff person that didn't acknowledge me when I was standing right in front of her at the desk. After getting her attention and letting her know that I wanted to check in she continued fumbling around. I put that aside, went to my room and went out for the night with the other individual that was staying with me. The next morning I went down to get breakfast and the milk was warm as was the orange juice, terrible breakfast for the price of the room. Finally, upon checkout, the staff member argued with me, didn't offer a receipt and insisted that there would be no further charges. Upon checking my balance of my checking account I had noticed that the hotel charged me an additional $90 for no apparent reason and overdrafted my account in the process. This hotel singlehandedly ruined my trip to Toronto. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Very good for a low budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: dieWende
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very central and had a great price! The room was clean, breakfast was nice and the people were friendly. I will definitely go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Locked out of our room, with our son still in it, before the 12 PM checkout time”
Reviews.Author: pjmcg33
Reviews.Content: Not having thought to check whether the hotel had an elevator when booking, I ended up having to carry our 45 lb disabled child and his 50+ lb wheelchair up three flights of stairs in two trips. While doing the same thing the next day to leave, the hotel staff seemed (as far as we can gather) to have preemptively disabled the keycard to the room, locking our son in the room for several minutes while I went downstairs to have a card re-activated. All this took place within the twenty minutes or so before the prescribed 12 PM checkout deadline, and it was still before 12 by the time we walked out. The room itself was nothing special as expected for the price, and the quality of sleep was not great due to road noise and thin insubstantial pillows. The headboard of the bed would also vibrate noticeably when heavy trucks passed. Amusingly, the cleaning staff also apparently missed the fact that a previous guest had covered the peep hole in the door with chewing gum. Overall the experience would have been fairly tolerable if it weren't for the keycard 'malfunction ' and the fact that we didn't anticipate the lack of an elevator. It's possible that we weren't intentionally locked out of the room, but why else would both keycards suddenly become inactive? They weren't rubbed on any magnets or anything like that. The feeling we got was that we were being shooed out the door because we had waited until close to the checkout deadline. Reading some of the other reviews here reinforces that gut feeling. Up until checkout time we would potentially have been repeat customers (armed with a ground floor reservation, extra pillows and perhaps earplugs), but now there is no chance.

Reviews.Title: “It's not as bad as the reviews make of it”
Reviews.Author: pinkgelato_
Reviews.Content: We had gotten this hotel randomly through HotWire, which offered it at a really cheap rate. After finding out our mystery hotel was EconoLodge, I was extremely hesitant to stay the night, because as a Native Torontonian, and someone who used to go to high school around the area, I knew that this area didn't have the greatest reputation. Walking into the hotel, I expected it to be dirty all around, but in fact it was not. It was quite pleasant, staff were friendly. Their was no smell of smoke in the hallway or room. Our room was small, but the bed was comfy. The location was both quiet and loud. It is in a downtown location, so what would you expect? But, it is a 10 min walk to the Eaton Centre and a ton of amazing restaurants. It is also a 5 min walk from a green house (Allan Gardens), in case you're interested. Breakfast was basic...toast, cereal, coffee, orange juice, and tea were provided. I'll be honest, I would recommend this hotel during the colder months, because in the hotter months, I would assume that it would be louder because of the location and the amount of activity.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Location, Poor Service, Dirty Room - Stay Anywhere but Here.”
Reviews.Author: Rachilvano
Reviews.Content: We came to this hotel in August, after a friend booked a room for us. He unfortunately did not read the reviews beforehand, because every negative statement is correct. The hotel is located in a sketchy part of town, with prostitutes on the corner out front, a drug-rehab center one street back, and countless people with various 'issues' wandering around the sidewalks. This is not the hotel's fault, but it certainly doesn't help when added to the hotel's problems. The building itself is cramped and dirty - when we walked up the small staircase to our room, there were used towels piled in the hallway. The small, dark room had an unpleasant smell, and the air conditioner was broken so they had a makeshift in-room AC unit with a duct going out the window. The carpet and walls had a variety of stains, and the sheets had a hole from a cigarette burn. Best of all, the bathroom soap was opened. We both knew there was no way we'd be able to sleep there, so we checked out 30 minutes after checking in. The manager didn't appear to believe our complaints could be true, but offered to move us to another room. We said no and left - this place was horrendous, and you could get better for a $30-a-night motel off the highway. Please do yourself a favor and DON'T STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “If you could say it in one sentence, what would you say?”
Reviews.Author: Chrisnel
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a huge disappointment. We had been on the road for 3wks when we finally got here & couldn't believe how awful this place is. Parking is a block away with no signage to indicate this. The staff at the front desk were not very welcoming or friendly when we arrived. The front desk & breakfast area are done nicely but our room was a disaster. It was very small, dark & dingy with a terrible smell. The floors are uneven under the carpet which makes walking on them uncomfortable. You could here everything going on in the halls & other rooms & we were kept awake by people coming in late & the noises they made when they finally got to their rooms. Couldn't leave quick enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for a Xmas Vacay”
Reviews.Author: KFL_3
Reviews.Content: This was my second time back to the hotel. For one main reason, the LOCATION! The first time was for Pride in June and a Christmas vacation with my boyfriend this past December. The staff is helpful. Although, you will get the occasional young front desk agent who's first response is "um, I dunno". The managers however have ALWAYS been helpful. Either way, the rooms are ok for the affordable rate. They are small, but the beds are comfortable, the TVs always work, and their free wifi is pretty fast. They do fail on breakfast though.

Reviews.Title: “I left there wanting to hit the hotel manager in his face!!! No joking!!!”
Reviews.Author: michelled1979
Reviews.Content: A friend and myself had to travel to Toronto to see a doctor. We found this place because it was a 5 minute walk from the clinic we needed to go to, and we didn't want to have to travel all over a city neither of us had been to. When we booked our rooms, we accidentally requested a smoking room, although neither of us smoked, and if anything I get picked on by friends and relatives for being the "non smoking complainer" and my friend can't be around it! Anyway, when we got there, we explained that it was an honest mistake and requested a non-smoking room if available...there was one. We stayed for one night. There were only two pillows in the room, so I phoned down to the front desk and asked if there were any additional pillows available, He rudely and bluntly told me that they had a full house, so no and hung up. FYI...for our entire visit, we didn't see or hear anyone else in the motel, and we had come and gone a few times both days...odd. So, the next day, we check out on time, figured everything was fine, and went about our day of site seeing with a relative who lived in Toronto. An hour later, my friend gets a message on her cell phone...saying that we smoked in the room and they had evidence (like we were criminals) and that they were going to charge her credit card an additional $100. They even went as far as to say that they were "very dissappointed in you girls, you requested a non-smoking room and then just smoked in it anyway"....you girls, hmmm, we are in our 30's, not two 14 year olds renting rooms! So as soon as we got this message, we turned the cab around and went back to figure out what happened. They said the maid found a juice bottle in the garbage with a cigarette butt in it. ASked were this so called bottle was and they had already disposed of it...convenient! I got very upset, explaining that we found this to be very insulting, especially since my friend had asthma and would have had an attack had either of smoked, on top of the fact that we both find smoking to be disgusting (personal opinion!). My other question was, do you seriously expect me to believe a maid went through the garbage container??! Wierd. Needless to say, I would not recommend this motel to anyone, the front desk staff was beyond rude, almost like they made a game of how rude each other could be... the room was very small about two feet on either side of the bed, then walls...the bathroom was okay, not dirty, but not spotless....no elevator, but not a huge deal...had I been able to rate of parts a ZERO, I would have!

Reviews.Title: “BEDBUGS - stay away”
Reviews.Author: Aurona
Reviews.Content: This hotel was horrible, My coleague complained about bedbugs and was given another room, but is room also had bugs. To top it all, the manager started abusing me when I told him it is difficult to see the bugs and that my colleague is not lying. He was bitten al over! Stay away at all costs - the rooms are dirty, ridden with bedbugs, rooms are cleaned very late in the afternoon, the breakfast consists of bread, abd above all, the manager is rude and arrogant when you have a problem.

Reviews.Title: “The worst place to stay ever”
Reviews.Author: keb31
Reviews.Content: This is the worst place we have ever stayed on our long trip through Canada and the States. Smallest rooms, non smoking, but that didn't stop other guests smoking cigarettes and marijuana. Can hear everyone above you, below you and next door. Room service came and only tidied one bed. And the worst - the bathroom looks like it hasn't been cleaned in months - the dirt on the toilet and roll holder and around the sinks is so thick you can scrape it off.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Overlaid
Reviews.Content: I stopped here for one night on my way from visiting another city, where I also stayed at an Econo Lodge. It's surprising the difference in standards between the two. This hotel is at an excellent location, an easy walk to almost anywhere you might want to go. Handy to shopping, leisurely walks and the gay village. Parking was two blocks away but I knew that when I booked. My third floor room (no elevator) faced a cement courtyard, but I wasn't there for the view. The WiFi worked fine, front desk was helpful, breakfast was once again nothing special except they had great bagels. The room was clean, appeared to be recently updated, and overall was a good place to spend the night. I would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to explore downtown Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: pikes
Reviews.Content: I admit I was a bit worried by some of the reviews I had read here, but then I found a very well kept small hotel with incredibly friendly staff for a great rate and in a perfect location - everything downtown Toronto in easy walking distance. There are several public parking spaces around, I left my car two blocks away and the rate was 10 Dollars/day or 5/night. My room was absolutely clean and the interior was like new. The bed was very comfortable, and there was a modern airconditioning system. Best of all, directed towards the inner courtyard, the room was absolutely quiet. The lady at the front desk gave me a great orientation to start off my two days in town, and when I mentioned I was interested in a hop-on hop-off bus tour, she was happy to arrange everything for me, including the pick-up. The breakfast was the usual "free continental breakfast" standard, nothing special, but ok. I had a great time in Toronto and found absolutely nothing to complain about in this hotel. I explored downtown, the Entertainment District, Chinatown, University area, Market Street and Yorkville, and everything is in easy walking distance. I walked around alone any time of day and night, and felt perfectly safe. Yes, the area east of Jarvis, behind the hotel, is a bit shady, but hey, this is a big city and I canÂ´t believe that people would rate down the hotel for this. At an online rate of 84 dollars I assume this was one of the best deals in town.

Reviews.Title: “Prostitute parties? Homophobia? I think not.”
Reviews.Author: Daynyte
Reviews.Content: Me and my mate stayed in the Econo Lodge during our move to Toronto and were both pleased on the first few nights. The bed was comfy, the hotel was reasonable, and the bathroom was kept clean. Never judge a book by it's cover though... As it started to slip into warmer weather, the hotel became "party central". It seems everynight there was some sort of party, random people running through the halls, whole floors would become abnoxiously noisy, prostitutes came in and out daily, not joking, we seen one of them being paid outside after hearing her moaning loudly in the room down the hall on second floor for about 45 minutes at 2:30 in the morning. Then another one was heard outside below our window on the second floor in around 4 a.m. This was one of many many incidents of which have occured since we've gotten here, including screaming young hotel guests streaking acrossed Jarvis Street, harassing and threatening homosexuals who went by. I was very offended that front desk took this homophobia as a joke being that the hotel is so close to the gay village. Everytime something like this would happen, front desk would find a reason to not have to deal with the situation. "We can't control what people come in and out of our hotel" was my favourite. On my final night in the Econo lodge, I finally got fed up with their neglect for responsibility and threatened that if me or my mate heard one more sound, or hooker, we would take our business elsewhere. I would NEVER recommend this hotel to a family, quiet couple, or homosexuals. It may be alright if you are a single person who can tolerate poor service, excessive noise, and the red-light district. Other than that, I'd recommend spending an extra dollar and trying someplace else like the Bond Place hotel. Cheaper isn't always better, the Econo Lodge is living proof.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Poor but you get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: kipster39
Reviews.Content: Sort of agree with previous reviewers, its clear people had been smoking in rooms, apart from that, was pretty happy with the room considering what id paid for it, its pretty well downtown, 20 min walk anywhere, although does seem to be based in the red light area, some hookers based outside my room every evening from 1030-0200 made pretty interesting late night entertainment. Being a solo male traveller location and room were fine. Its cheap, just keep telling yourself that. Brek is fine, several loaves, peanut butter, cheese, jelly, coffee, jiuice, cereal, but you do feel you are eating in a hotel lobby. I probably wouldnt stay there again as i would look for somewhere better. Friends stayed at the Delta Chelsea which was big but seemed pretty impressive.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: Lyn2005
Reviews.Content: We unfortunately had to make a trip to Toronto during the week of the Toronto Film Festival and everything was booked. Our only choice was the Econo Lodge. The room was small but that wasn't the problem. There were cigarette burns and filth on the carpet, I didn't even want to take my shoes off. There were cigarette burns on the base of every lamp, on the bathroom vanity, on the toilet lid. The upper window was open with no screen in it and we could only close it part way. In the morning I went to use the hair dryer after my shower and it wouldn't work. I called the front desk and proceeded to ask for assistance and was hung up on before I could finish. I called back and the fellow said he had no idea how to make it work. By that time my hair was drying on its own so I made do with some hair spray. Upon closer examination I noticed the reason the dryer wouldn't work - whoever created the burns must have left a cigarette burning close to the cord of the dryer because it was burnt through to the wires. A definate safety hazard, couldn't believe the staff didn't know about this. The best part about the room was the bed, it was quite comfortable. I emailed the link on their websites for comments concerning their facilities but all I have recieved is a form email saying someone would get back to me and I've received nothing else. Don't stay here. A much nicer hotel and nicer area is the Strathcona, it's less money too.

Reviews.Title: “Sort of okay”
Reviews.Author: AmesIowa
Reviews.Content: Contrary to the earlier reviewer who mentioned getting a permit from the hotel to park free on the street, the hotel does not make this available now (at least they told us they had nothing like this). We ended up paying $13 a day for parking in a lot three blocks away - no big problem, but if we'd known to factor in the parking cost, we might have chosen to stay elsewhere. The room itself was okay, aside from a few minor cigarette burns in carpet and blanket - had to carry suitcases up to second floor since no elevator, but we were fine with that. After the first day, we ignored the free breakfast - can't get excited about a few semi-stale bread choices, three cereals, and weak orange juice. Location is about a fifteen minute walk from interesting downtown sites - no problem if you're a good walker. Location is a bit marginal - the area to the west has a university and feels mostly okay; the area to the south has other hotels and feels mostly okay. But just half a block to the east you run into a homeless area that feels definitely more unsafe. I felt sort of okay walking back to the hotel around 11 pm with my husband, but this would feel definitely unsafe for a lone traveler.

Reviews.Title: “just OK place with a comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: forzuto13
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night only since I had an overnight layover in Toronto and I was on a budget so I chose this place based on location and price. It was pretty basic with cigarette burns in carpets and bedspread, wallpaper peeling in places, and worst of all - hairs left in the sink and tub. That is one thing that really gets to me when I stay at a place. At that point I chose to not look too closely at the room environment. On the plus side, the queen bed was very comfortable and firm. The facilities were modern enough with no plumbing problems or anything. Also, the TV had a lot of channels and was big, if you care about those things. There is no elevator, but only has two floors anyway. Front desk staff was pretty aloof. The breakfast was very basic, but at least had bagels with cream cheese and OJ. I have had much worse for the free continental breakfast. All in all it is passable for a night or two and good enough for budget-minded people. Location is not too bad either, only four blocks from metro stop, and in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for price”
Reviews.Author: bflosbr77
Reviews.Content: I visited Toronto w/my best friend for a "girls weekend". Upon check-in we were put into the wrong room but that was corrected after a short time. The room was clean and neat. Some of the other guests were a little "shady", but nobody gave us any problems (I would avoid staying on the third floor). Unfortunately never got up early enough to enjoy the continental breakfast. The power did go out for about eight hours one evening (at no fault of the hotel), but we were not informed at all what happened or when the power would be back on. Hotel is close to train and even walking distance to major attractions. And there is a Tim Hortons right down the block, which was a bonus! Would definately stay there again for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Decent budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: tjones4
Reviews.Content: This is a half-decent hotel. My room was quite big, clean, well equipped and was also good value. The breakfast was quite poor - self-service cereal and toast with polystyrene bowls and plastic cutlery. It's a good 15-20 minute walk into downtown Toronto which didn't bother me, but I wouldn't feel safe walking south on Jarvis Street towards the harbour late at night. Beware of the way they handle bookings. The website where I made my booking didn't charge up front but simply calculated an estimated fee. They make the point that the final fee could be different. Unfortunately, I witnessed two unhappy guests - one whose booking was lost and another who complained about not being refunded a security deposit. Altogether, I would recommend this hotel for those on a budget - but just make sure you have all your paperwork.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for budget minded travellers”
Reviews.Author: wxlady
Reviews.Content: This is a good budget hotel in downtown Toronto. I paid $88.00 CAD. (taxes incl.) This included free internet, air conditioning, TV, hairdryer, and continental breakfast. The room wasn't in the best of shape and there was dust on the furniture. There were several cigarette burns on the carpet, markings on the wallpaper, and damage on the washroom ceiling, but the queen bed was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at an Excellent Rate!”
Reviews.Author: Rons1961
Reviews.Content: Excellent budget hotel in downtown Toronto. Just minutes from Eaton Centre by walking and at great savings in room price. Hotel was clean and nice, but no elevator for the upper floors. We had a very nice queen size room and was well taken care of by the staff. Even saved a gift that I mistakenly placed near the trash and the staff kept it and asked us about it. Very friendly and honest. Would definately stay there again when next in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here five nights in April 2006. The hotel has only recently opened after refurbishment so everything is clean and new. Great location in Downtown Toronto close to all the main attractions and shopping. We even got free parking in the side street with the use of a permit from the Hotel. There is no bar, restaurant or other amenities in this hotel but at $80 CA (Â£40) including taxes this was one of the cheapest and best hotels I stayed in whilst touring Ontario. Some rooms have a fridge or computer; all rooms have TV, hairdryer, iron. Only slight drawback some visitors might find off-putting is beggars on the street corners asking for money but just say no and walk on. All in all excellent value for money.

HotelInfo.Name: Econo Lodge Inn & Suites Downtown
HotelInfo.Address: 335 Jarvis Street, Toronto, Ontario M5B 2C2, Canada
